intro: Spermacoce pusilla, commonly known as little spermacoce, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Spermacoce pusilla is often found in disturbed soils and thrives in moist, shaded environments.
